alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT/245 AM EDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Clay and Early. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT /245 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 PM CDT /1131 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Haleburg, Willis Crossroads, Hardwickburg, Abbeville Municipal A/P, Shorterville, Graball, Screamer, Barnes, Murphy Station, Hayes, Miller, Lawrenceville and Edwin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
